intro: Eleutheroglossum fellowsii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming compact rosettes. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
